page.title: 12Reservoirs and Old Quarries
page.content:
At the western end of the area are two reservoirs built in the early 1900s which now serve the twon of Longridge. The intake for these reservoirs being the streams of Dean and Cowley situated farther east on the Fell, and suplemented by a piped supply from the large reservoirs built to serve Preston and situated to the south of Longridge.
The old stone quarry, now a residential and touring caravan site provided the stone for the Municipal buildings in Preston and was quarried extensively in the 1830s. Nearby is the old Copy Quarry which was re-opened to extract stone for the Broughton to Blackpool motorway in the 1970s. This has since been landscaped and an angling society has the fishing rights to the pond.
